full_title_en: TNM Staging for Hepatocellular Carcinoma (HCC) (8th Edition)
medium_description_en: Stages HCC based on tumor, lymph nodes, and metastases (recommended as of 2017).

seo.meta_description_en: The TNM Staging for Hepatocellular Carcinoma (HCC) (2017) stages hepatocellular carcinoma based on tumor, lymph node, and metastasis characteristics.

how_to_use.use_case_en: Patients diagnosed with HCC, including fibrolamellar HCC, who have undergone surgical resection.
how_to_use.pearls_pitfalls_en:
• Stages HCC by tumor, nodes, and metastasis characteristics.

  • Requires pathologic specimen for evaluation, thus limiting its use since most HCC patients do not undergo surgical resection.

  • Does not account for liver function, which is a known prognostic factor in HCC and cirrhosis.
how_to_use.why_use_en:
• Gives prognosis of HCC when pathologic data is available.

  • Barcelona Clinic Liver Cancer (BCLC) staging may be more clinically useful, as it incorporates liver function and patient functional status, and does not require a pathologic specimen.

next_steps.advice_en:
• National Comprehensive Cancer Network (NCCN) guidelines use TNM staging for treatment recommendations, but note that many staging systems exist, all have limitations, and some are region-dependent.

  • Can only be used if patient has had surgical resection.

about.evidence_based_medicine_en: The TNM staging system for HCC, like all TNM staging systems, was developed by the American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC).

Original/Primary Reference.text: American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC). AJCC Cancer Staging Manual. 8th ed. New York: Springer; 2017.

Validation.text: Kee KM, Wang JH, Lee CM, Chen CL, Changchien CS, Hu TH, Cheng YF, Hsu HC, Wang CC, Chen TY, Lin CY, Lu SN. Validation of clinical AJCC/UICC TNM staging system for hepatocellular carcinoma: analysis of 5,613 cases from a medical center in southern Taiwan. Int J Cancer. 2007 Jun 15;120(12):2650-5.

Kee KM, Wang JH, Lin CY, Wang CC, Cheng YF, Lu SN. Validation of the 7th edition TNM staging system for hepatocellular carcinoma: an analysis of 8,828 patients in a single medical center. Dig Dis Sci. 2013 Sep;58(9):2721-8.

Clinical Practice Guidelines.text: National Comprehensive Cancer Network (NCCN). NCCN Clinical Practice Guidelines in Oncology: Hepatobiliary Cancers. Version 2; 2018.

creator_info.about_en: Ghassan K. Abou-Alfa, MD, is a medical oncologist at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center. He is also chair of the National Cancer Institute (NCI) Task Force for Hepatobiliary Cancers. Dr. Abou-Alfa’s primary research is focused on small molecule-based therapy for hepatobiliary and pancreatic cancers.
